The Participant is on track to implement selected Care Redesign interventions within the timeframes indicated within the Care Redesign Plan.
Please provide 2-3 sentences below describing the progress of your high priority Care Redesign Interventions:
Response: Upon the decision of surgery, the patient and family are educated about their surgery and post-acute discharge plan. The patient is introduced to the QPathways patient engagement platform and their Care Coordinator. Following the clinical assessment, the care coordinators work with the patients during the pre and post-operative periods. The care coordinators and physicians take a proactive approach to setting expectations with the patient and family related to the expected discharge plan and status.

Text: Do you have concerns regarding implementation of any identified Care Redesign Interventions?
Please use the comment box below to provide additional details regarding successes, challenges, and/or barriers to Care Redesign Interventions.
Response: Once the physician makes the post-acute care plan that information is communicated to the patient, family, care coordinator, hospital, as well as all post-acute care providers that will be involved in the patients care. Our unique QPathways care platform allows for collaborative communication between the patient, physician, and entire care team.

Text: The Participant and/or the Downstream Episode Initiator(s) is on track to implement Certified Electronic Health Record Technology (CEHRT) in a manner sufficient to meet the applicable requirements of the Advanced Alternative Payment Model criterion under 42 C.F.R. & 414.1415(a)(1)(i). To meet this criterion, at least 75 percent of eligible clinicians in each participating APM Entity group, or each hospital if hospitals are the APM Entities, to use CEHRT to document and communicate clinical care.

Has the Participant established a BPCI Advanced Entity Agreement with a BPCI Advanced Entity?
Response: NA; we don't have relationship with a BPCI Advanced Entity

Text: Please describe key considerations that informed the Participant's decision (e.g. willingness to take on risk) regarding establishing Financial Arrangements.
Response: The physicians willingness to change their practices that would provide patients with positive outcomes while decreasing the use of unnecessary ancillary post acute services, as well as the physician's willingness to take on risk. We don't have financial relationships with physicians that do not take on risk with us.

Text: Does the Participant plan to track and allow contribution of ICS associated with BPCI Advanced to the BPCI Advanced Savings Pool(s) in the next 12 months?
If selected 'Yes' to question 1, has the Participant established a process to measure and track Internal Cost Savings associated with BPCI Advanced?
Response: NA; we don't participate in ICS Sharing

Text: Does the Participant plan to share NPRA associated with BPCI Advanced in the first performance period, if savings are achieved? [Performance Period 1: October 1, 2018 through June 30, 2019]
Has the Participant implemented processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please describe your processes and procedures to monitor Shared Repayment Amounts associated with BPCI Advanced.
Response: All Physician Members (owners) of the TRIARQ Health Alliance are responsible equally for any Repayment Amounts due. Physicians are responsible to pay their portion immediately upon notification of an amount due. Our reconciliation and accounting systems track how much of the Repayment Amount due and paid by each physician.

Text: If selected 'Yes' to question 2, please provide a brief explanation of that process below.
Response: We ensure there are always 3 employees that have access to and understand how to navigate and submit documents through the BPCI portal.  We all attend the webinars, read our emails daily and are members of several BPCI forum groups as well.

If selected 'Other' to question 1, please describe the communication channel used to provide beneficiary notifications.
Does the Participant use the template Beneficiary Notification Letter provided by CMS?
If selected 'No' to question 3, please explain.
Has provision of the beneficiary notification of participation resulted in negative feedback from beneficiaries?
If selected 'Yes' to question 5, what are the primary concerns from the beneficiary perspective?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected positive outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
Has the Participant seen any unexpected negative outcomes associated with implementing BPCI Advanced?
If selected 'Yes' to either question 1 or 2, please describe.
Response: We have seen an overall decrease length of stay at Skilled nursing facilities with patients going home sooner they have had a decrease in hospital readmissions related to post-operative infection.  We have also seen a dramatic decrease in the number of patents being discharged to a Skilled nursing facility from the hospital.  There has also been a decrease in use of unnecessary home health.

Text: Has the Participant established a process for monitoring and mitigating unintended consequences (e.g., patient targeting/avoidance, inadequate or insufficient care, costshifting) associated with implementation of the BPCI Advanced Model?
If selected 'Yes' to question 4, please describe.
Response: We educate the providers to always maintain best practices and treat the patient with any needed services.  We monitor patients status in real time to ensure they are meeting their therapy goals and that there are no complications. If a patient is having any signs of complications the MD is immediately notified.  We ensure that all providers agree to treat the patient using best practices.

Response: Often due dates for forms other than the QPP or FAL are not listed in a user friendly manner.  For example,  this document was difficult to find and we had not received the email notifying that we were to submit with group 1.
